intro: Ormocarpopsis parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved orchid tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its slender, often branched stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and pleasant scent. Ormocarpopsis parvifolia is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes and other nitrogen-fixing plants.
